snippet: Major League Soccer is running Chivas U.S.A. as it undergoes a rebranding and seeks a new owner and a stadium of its own.
abstract: Major League Soccer's experience with Chivas USA in California has largely been a failure, and lessons learned have mostly been how not to run a franchise; club was created in 2004 with high hopes of tapping into large Hispanic market but selling the Chivas brand to non-Mexicans and expatriate fans of other top Mexican clubs proved difficult, and poor management decisions were stacked one upon the next.
lead_paragraph: Major League Soccer is running Chivas U.S.A. as it undergoes a rebranding and seeks a new owner and a stadium of its own.

headline.seo: Chivas U.S.A. Trying to Escape M.L.S. Doldrums
headline.main: A Soccer Team Struggles to Remake Its Identity
headline.print_headline: An M.L.S. Team Struggles to Remake Its Identity
